item.title: LA Clashes Escalate as Trump, Newsom Spar Over National Guard
item.description: Tensions flared in Los Angeles on the third day of anti-deportation protests, as demonstrators clashed with law enforcement while President Donald Trump and California Governor Gavin Newsom exchanged blame over the unrest and responsibility for restoring order.
item.dc:creator: Alicia A. Caldwell, John Gittelsohn

media:content.media:description: National Guard soldiers and US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Police officers clash with demonstrators outside the Metropolitan Detention Center, MDC, in downtown Los Angeles, California on June 8, 2025. US President Donald Trump deployed 2,000 troops on June 7 to handle escalating protests against immigration enforcement raids in the Los Angeles area, a move the state's governor termed "purposefully inflammatory." Federal agents clashed with angry crowds in a Los Angeles suburb as protests stretched into a second night Saturday, shooting flash-bang grenades and shutting part of a freeway amid raids on undocumented migrants, reports said. (Photo by Frederic J. Brown / AFP) (Photo by FREDERIC J. BROWN/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: US, China to Resume Trade Talks With Focus on Rare Earths
item.description: The US and China are set to resume trade negotiations in London on Monday in a bid to further defuse tensions over rare-earth minerals and advanced technology following a phone call between leaders Donald Trump and Xi Jinping last week.
item.dc:creator: Catherine Lucey, Daniel Flatley

item.title: Israel Blocks Greta Thunberg’s Ship From Reaching Gaza, Group Says
item.description: Israel intercepted a humanitarian aid ship trying to reach Gaza that was carrying activists including Swedish climate advocate Greta Thunberg, the group operating the vessel said.

item.title: Senator in Intensive Care Shows Colombia Spinning Out of Control
item.description: Last Thursday, presidential hopeful Miguel Uribe Turbay warned that Colombia was fast sinking back into its violent past. Two days later, a gunman shot him in the head during a rally.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Bristow, Patricia Laya

media:content.media:description: A protest against violence the day after the attack on Uribe in Medellin, Colombia, on June 8. Photographer: Jaime Saldarriaga/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Starmer Calls on Nvidia’s Huang to Train Up Britons on AI
item.description: Keir Starmer will make an appearance alongside Nvidia Corp co-founder Jensen Huang on Monday, as the British prime minister puts technology and artificial intelligence at the heart of his government’s plan to boost economic growth.
item.dc:creator: Julian Harris

media:content.media:description: Jensen Huang, co-founder and chief executive officer of Nvidia Corp., during the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on Tuesday, May 20, 2025. Computex kicked off Monday in Taipei, and as in years past will draw industry chieftains from and Huang Qualcomm Inc.'s Cristiano Amon to Young Liu of Foxconn, which makes the bulk of the world's iPhones and Nvidia servers.

item.title: Trump Says National Guard Will Restore Order, End Unrest in LA
item.description: President Donald Trump pledged Sunday to send whatever is necessary to California to respond to two days of protests in Los Angeles triggered by sweeping immigration raids.
item.dc:creator: Vincent Lee, Maria Paula Mijares Torres, Catherine Lucey

media:content.media:description: LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA - JUNE 08: National Guard troops stand outside the Metropolitan Detention Center, MDC on June 08, 2025 in Los Angeles, California. Tensions in the city remain high after the Trump administration called in the National Guard against the wishes of city leaders following two days of clashes with police during a series of immigration raids. More protests are scheduled for today. (Photo by Spencer Platt/Getty Images)

item.title: Italy Votes on Citizenship, Job Protections Amid Turnout Concern
item.description: ROME (AP) — Italians vote over two days starting Sunday in referendums that would make it easier for children born in Italy to foreigners to obtain citizenship, and on providing more job protections. But apparent low public awareness risks rendering the votes invalid if turnout is not high enough.

media:content.media:description: Campaign posters calling for a vote in a referendum in downtown Rome.

item.title: Venezuela Plans a 50% Fuel Hike as It Braces for Revenue Slump
item.description: Venezuela’s government is laying the groundwork for a 50% hike in fuel prices at the pump as it braces for a decrease in revenues after US oil major Chevron and other oil firms halted work in the country.
item.dc:creator: Fabiola Zerpa

media:content.media:description: A Petroleos de Venezuela SA (PDVSA) gas station in Puerto La Cruz, Anzoategui state, Venezuela, on Monday, May 22, 2023. Venezuela’s Oil ministry published oil and gas reserves for years 2019 through 2022, according to a decree in the official gazette dated May 9.

item.description: The Israeli army on Sunday said it recovered the body of Mohammed Sinwar, a senior Hamas commander who was killed in a May 13 airstrike at a Gaza hospital.

item.title: Colombia Candidate Fighting for Life After Assassination Bid
item.description: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay remains in a critical condition after an assassination attempt on Saturday that recalled the political violence that roiled the nation in the 1980s and 1990s.

item.title: US Seeks Deal in London on China Rare Earth Flows, Hassett Says
item.description: US negotiators will aim to restore the flow of critical minerals when they meet their Chinese counterparts for a new round of trade negotiations Monday in London, a top economic aide to President Donald Trump said.

media:content.media:description: Various rare earth minerals on display in a showroom at the Baotou Jiangxin Micro Motor Technology Co., in Baotou, Inner Mongolia, China, on Thursday, June 1, 2023. item.title: UK Vows Due Diligence on China Embassy Amid Security Concerns
item.description: The UK government promised to assess any security concerns related to the construction of a Chinese embassy near the City of London, an issue that could potentially complicate trade talks with the US.
